title: Statement by Press Secretary Josh Earnest and Former Press Secretaries on the Passing of James Brady | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House
Office of the Press Secretary


For Immediate Release
August 04, 2014

 



Statement by Press Secretary Josh Earnest and Former Press Secretaries on the Passing of James Brady




Statement by Press Secretary Josh Earnest and Former Press Secretaries Jay Carney, Robert Gibbs, Dana Perino, Scott McClellan, Ari Fleischer, Jake Siewert, Joe Lockhart, Mike McCurry, Dee Dee Myers, Marlin Fitzwater, and Ron Nessen
Jim Brady defined the role of the modern White House Press Secretary. With his passing we lost a friend and mentor, and the country lost a selfless public servant who dedicated his life to service, even in the face of tragedy. Jim always did his job with the highest integrity. He had a true affection and respect for the press, relished a good sparring with the front row, and was an unfailing defender of the President and the value of a free press. Jim set the model and standard for the rest of us to follow. It's been a genuine honor for each of us to stand at the podium in the briefing room that will always bear his name. Our thoughts and prayers are with Jimâ€™s wife Sarah and his children Scott and Melissa.
